intro: Phyllanthus sandwicensis f. rufidus, commonly known as the roughleaf sandwicensis, is a rare plant endemic to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub characterized by its rough, textured leaves and small, clustered flowers. The species belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes a variety of plants with diverse ecological roles. Its unique morphology and restricted habitat make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and invasive species.
